DOC.brief_summary: Videolaryngoscopes become widely used. The aim of this study is to compare McGrath Mac videolaryngoscope to conventional MacIntosh laryngoscope in patients without known risk of difficult of mask ventilation and of tracheal intubation.
DOC.brief_title: McGrath Mac VideoLaryngoscope vs the Macintosh Laryngoscope
DOC.criteria: patient scheduled for a general anesthesia with orotracheal intubation predictable risk of difficult mask ventilation or of difficult tracheal intubation necessity of a rapid sequence induction contraindication to sufentanil, to propofol, or to atracurium ENT, thoracic surgery, or intracranial surgery
